Systems:

SCOUT

MARKER RIFLE

No description given.

SIGHT

The Scout ignores Hidden and Invisible – they know the precise location of all characters within Sensors.

REBOUND SCAN

All characters of the Scout’s choice within range 5 must make a Systems save. On a failure, they immediately lose Hidden and Invisible, and can’t regain either status or benefit from any cover until the start of the Scout’s next turn.

CLOAKING FIELD

The Scout generates a Burst 3 cloaking field that lasts until the end of their next turn. The Scout and allied characters within the affected area are Invisible, but the Scout is Immobilized while it is active.

SYSTEM FLAYER

Characters that fail to save against Rebound Scan also receive Lock On and take {2/3/4} Heat.

EXPOSE WEAKNESS

Characters that are successfully attacked with the Marker Rifle take +{4/6/8} bonus damage the next time they are successfully hit with a ranged or melee attack. If it isn’t triggered, this effect lasts for the rest of the scene.

VETERAN

REINFORCED

The ELF gains +1 Structure and +1 Stress.

SPACER

MANEUVERABLE

The ELF moves normally in zero-g environments.

Spec Op

Operatives

When choosing optional systems and traits, the Spec Ops can also choose from the Spec Ops Systems and Traits list. Additionally, the Spec Ops can’t take the Grunt, Elite, or Ultra templates.

Active Camo

As a protocol, the Spec Ops may expend a charge to become Invisible until the end of their next turn. For the duration of this effect, the Spec Ops’ next melee or ranged attack becomes a critical hit if it hits.

Coordinated Carnage

After all Spec Ops characters have taken their turns in a round, a single Spec Ops character may take an additional turn in the usual turn order.

Jump Packs

The Spec Ops can fly whenever it Boosts. It must end this movement on a solid surface or begin falling.

Null-Perception Coating

The Spec Ops gains Immunity to Lock On.

Automated Battlefield Awareness Node

The Spec Ops gains the Battlefield Awareness reaction, which can be used any number of times per round. This system can only be taken by one Spec Ops per combat.
Battlefield Awareness
Trigger: An allied Spec Ops character within Range 8 and line of sight would roll a save.
Effect: They automatically succeed on the save before rolling any dice.

Full-Spectrum Sensor Suite

The Spec Ops may Lock On as a protocol. Whenever an allied Spec Ops character within Range 10 consumes any Lock On, their attack is not affected by cover. This system can only be taken by one Spec Ops per combat.

HORNET

MISSILE DEFENSE NETWORK

Trigger:

A character within Sensors and line of sight attempts an attack against this character.


The target must pass a Systems save or their attack automatically misses.
